content: That's really helpful! I've been using my Nikon binoculars for birding, and they've been great, so I'll definitely consider Nikon's spotting scopes as well. I've also heard good things about Swarovski and Zeiss, so I'll look into those too. Do you think it's worth investing in a higher-end spotting scope, or would a mid-range one suffice for a casual birder like me?
